title: [K-12] Role-Play-Based Instructional Design for Enhancing Communication Skills in Phlebotomy Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic phlebotomy procedures and medical terminology comprehension, patient interaction experience
context.additional_context: Training program for university students with clinical practicum experience or laboratory work backgrounds, utilizing VR simulations and role-play to recreate real-world patient scenarios (cooperative/uncooperative, needle phobia, etc.)

learning_goals: Learners can apply tailored communication strategies according to various patient types (cooperative/anxious/uncooperative) in context-specific situations
Learners execute patient anxiety-reduction techniques (guided breathing, explanatory language use, etc.) with over 80% accuracy during blood-drawing procedures in VR simulations
Learners achieve a score of 4.0/5.0 or higher on role-play performance rubrics incorporating peer feedback
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
